      • size

        public final Vector3D size()
        The size of the heightmap in world units.\n When loading an image: \"size\" is used if present, otherwise defaults to 1x1x1.\n When loading a DEM: \"size\" is used if present, otherwise defaults to true size of DEM.\n

      • size

        public final Heightmap.Builder size(Vector3D value)
        The size of the heightmap in world units.\n When loading an image: \"size\" is used if present, otherwise defaults to 1x1x1.\n When loading a DEM: \"size\" is used if present, otherwise defaults to true size of DEM.\n

      • pos

        public final Vector3D pos()
        A position offset.

      • pos

        public final Heightmap.Builder pos(Vector3D value)
        A position offset.

      • texture

        public final List<Texture> texture()
        The heightmap can contain multiple textures. The order of the texture matters. The first texture will appear at the lowest height, and the last texture at the highest height. Use blend to control the height thresholds and fade between textures.

      • texture

        public final Heightmap.Builder texture(List<Texture> value)
        The heightmap can contain multiple textures. The order of the texture matters. The first texture will appear at the lowest height, and the last texture at the highest height. Use blend to control the height thresholds and fade between textures.

      • blend

        public final List<Blend> blend()
        The blend tag controls how two adjacent textures are mixed. The number of blend elements should equal one less than the number of textures.

      • blend

        public final Heightmap.Builder blend(List<Blend> value)
        The blend tag controls how two adjacent textures are mixed. The number of blend elements should equal one less than the number of textures.

      • useTerrainPaging

        public final Boolean useTerrainPaging()
        Set if the rendering engine will use terrain paging

      • useTerrainPaging

        public final Heightmap.Builder useTerrainPaging(Boolean value)
        Set if the rendering engine will use terrain paging

      • sampling

        public final Long sampling()
        Samples per heightmap datum. For rasterized heightmaps, this indicates the number of samples to take per pixel. Using a lower value, e.g. 1, will generally improve the performance of the heightmap but lower the heightmap quality.\n

      • sampling

        public final Heightmap.Builder sampling(Long value)
        Samples per heightmap datum. For rasterized heightmaps, this indicates the number of samples to take per pixel. Using a lower value, e.g. 1, will generally improve the performance of the heightmap but lower the heightmap quality.\n

      • build

        public final Heightmap build()
